article_text:
Kevin McCarthy suddenly quit his bid to succeed John Boehner as House Speaker on Thursday, amid an increasingly toxic crack-up inside the Republican conference. At 247 Members, the GOP enjoys its largest House majority since the 71st Congress of 1929-30—but a minority may squander it with ultimatums and self-sabotage.

Republicans met Thursday to nominate a candidate for Speaker, only for Mr. McCarthy to stand down before the ballot. By all accounts the California Republican would have won a majority. And in a normal...

twitter.description: Paul Ryan might be the only man who can stop GOP self-destruction, the Wall Street Journal argues in an editorial.
twitter.title: The Republican Crack-Up
